passages.text:
Giant Rat::No.  Even when your eyes are closed, you can still see blackness.

Giant Rat::Want to know what being dead is like?  Close your right eye, but not the left.  Think about what you can see out of your right eye.

Giant Rat::Absence.
passages.name: Is this what being dead is like?

passages.text: TODO consider moving death parts of intro here
passages.name: Untitled Passage

passages.text:
Jasper::If you find the closure you're after, miraculously cure all psychic ills in the process, use your newfound unhindered and undamaged brain to become rich and famous, and then retire early, then sure, this excursion will be "worth it."  

Jasper::But if you die here, you probably wouldn't consider it "worth it."

[[If I die I wouldn't consider it "not worth it" either, technically.]]
[[0;:I'm not a sea turtle.  I'm more similar to one of those toxic octopi.]]
[[1;p:Hopefully my Ferryman shows up soon, that way I can at least die closer to my goal and not in this shitty tunnel.]]

links.name: If I die I wouldn't consider it "not worth it" either, technically.
links.link: If I die I wouldn't consider it "not worth it" either, technically.

links.name: 0;:I'm not a sea turtle.  I'm more similar to one of those toxic octopi.
links.link: 0;:I'm not a sea turtle.  I'm more similar to one of those toxic octopi.

links.name: 1;p:Hopefully my Ferryman shows up soon, that way I can at least die closer to my goal and not in this shitty tunnel.
links.link: 1;p:Hopefully my Ferryman shows up soon, that way I can at least die closer to my goal and not in this shitty tunnel.

passages.name: p:This will all be worth it, right?

passages.text:
Jasper::But you'd consider it a shame right now, wouldn't you?  While your still breathing?

Jasper::Think about all the humiliation and unjustified pain; all of it would mean nothing if you were to die here.  You don't want that, do you?

Jasper::You'd just be one more baby sea turtle who never made it to the ocean.  You were born, pecked at, and now you'll die.

[[No one wants that.]] 
[[Those dead baby sea turtles are stress free.  There's nothing to worry about after you've been eaten by a crab.]]

links.name: No one wants that.
links.link: No one wants that.

links.name: Those dead baby sea turtles are stress free.  There's nothing to worry about after you've been eaten by a crab.
links.link: Those dead baby sea turtles are stress free.  There's nothing to worry about after you've been eaten by a crab.

passages.name: If I die I wouldn't consider it "not worth it" either, technically.

passages.text:
Jasper::Right now you've got more in common with an octopus's victim.  

Jasper::You're a tourist sap pumped full of tetrodotoxin.

Jasper::You are flat on your back, paralyzed.  You even lack the wit to shut your eyelids, and the foreign sun is turning your irises into swiss cheese.

[[Continue->p:This will all be worth it, right?]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:This will all be worth it, right?

passages.name: 0;:I'm not a sea turtle.  I'm more similar to one of those toxic octopi.

passages.text: Double-click this passage to edit it.
passages.name: 1;p:Hopefully my Ferryman shows up soon, that way I can at least die closer to my goal and not in this shitty tunnel.

passages.text:
Jasper::But plenty of people *get* that.

Jasper::You think any baby sea turtle plans on being the one to get eaten by a crab?  You think any kid in Scottish folk tales plans on being one of the children dragged down by a Kelpie?

[[Continue->p:This will all be worth it, right?]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:This will all be worth it, right?

passages.name: No one wants that.

passages.text:
Jasper::So you would consider the fate of 99.9% of baby sea turtles a success?

[[Continue->p:This will all be worth it, right?]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:This will all be worth it, right?

passages.name: Those dead baby sea turtles are stress free.  There's nothing to worry about after you've been eaten by a crab.

passages.text:
Jasper::You could easily climb this well.  Even fatigued, chimney-ing up this cylinder would require only mild sweating and grunting.

Jasper::But you won't.

[[Why wouldn't I?  Why can't I just pop out the top and roll around a little?]]
[[But sunlight is the only thing I crave.  I'm climbing out of here and basking in it for a bit.]]
[[p:It's not too late to turn back.  I can just pop out of this well and run straight out of the Cradle.]]

links.name: Why wouldn't I?  Why can't I just pop out the top and roll around a little?
links.link: Why wouldn't I?  Why can't I just pop out the top and roll around a little?

links.name: But sunlight is the only thing I crave.  I'm climbing out of here and basking in it for a bit.
links.link: But sunlight is the only thing I crave.  I'm climbing out of here and basking in it for a bit.

links.name: p:It's not too late to turn back.  I can just pop out of this well and run straight out of the Cradle.
links.link: p:It's not too late to turn back.  I can just pop out of this well and run straight out of the Cradle.

passages.name: p:I want to climb out.  Feel the sun and the air.

passages.text:
Jasper::Look at yourself.  You are covered in tar and stuck to the top of a terrifying but beautiful horse.  And the horse is doing its damndest to keep you down there, at the bottom of this well.  Anyone would find it difficult to climb under those circumstances.

Jasper::You came here for a reason.  You might flirt with the idea of bailing, escaping your fate, but deep down we both know what track your on.

Jasper::No one can help a puddle up the wall.

[[What the fuck are you talking about?]]
[[Why do I need to continue into the Cradle?  What's so important about that place?]]

links.name: What the fuck are you talking about?
links.link: What the fuck are you talking about?

links.name: Why do I need to continue into the Cradle?  What's so important about that place?
links.link: Why do I need to continue into the Cradle?  What's so important about that place?

passages.name: Why wouldn't I?  Why can't I just pop out the top and roll around a little?

passages.text:
Jasper::Alright, go for it.  No reason you can't get out of here and roll around in the fresh air for a few minutes.

Jasper::Go ahead.  Don't be long now.

Jasper::...

Jasepr::See?  You don't have the nerve.  

[[Continue->p:I want to climb out.  Feel the sun and the air.]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:I want to climb out.  Feel the sun and the air.

passages.name: But sunlight is the only thing I crave.  I'm climbing out of here and basking in it for a bit.

passages.text: Double-click this passage to edit it.
passages.name: p:It's not too late to turn back.  I can just pop out of this well and run straight out of the Cradle.

passages.text:
Jasper::Ugh.  Look, you came here looking for your Mom, right?  Everyone who comes to the Cradle is looking for closure of some form, and you're no different.  

[[I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.]]

links.name: I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.
links.link: I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.

passages.name: What the fuck are you talking about?

passages.text:
Jasper::Ostensibly, you came here to find out what happened to your Mom, remember?.  Everyone who comes to the Cradle is looking for closure of some form, and you're no different.  

[[I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.]]

links.name: I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.
links.link: I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.

passages.name: Why do I need to continue into the Cradle?  What's so important about that place?

passages.text:
Jasper::Really?  The void she left scabbed over, got filled with scar tissue - but never really healed.  No hair follicules grow in that part of your psyche. 

Jasper::She's the reason you aren't whole.  She's the reason you can't retire.  She's what you left behind here.

Jasper::That's why you are in a sewer and not running through a field of bullet ant infested sunflowers.

[[Continue->p:I want to climb out.  Feel the sun and the air.]]

links.name: Continue
links.link: p:I want to climb out.  Feel the sun and the air.

passages.name: I'm done caring about that.  I want to run around in a grassy field and get dehydrated and then get stung by a bunch of bees, or maybe a bullet ant.

passages.text:
You clamber down into the elevator.  The cabin is small, like a coffin.  The trim of the cabin is decorated by an array of ornate engravings.  They are beautiful, but not comforting.

You feel a squish beneath your left foot.  The smell of mild putrification invades your nostrils.  

[[p:(Action) investigate the strange texture beneath your left foot.]]

links.name: p:(Action) investigate the strange texture beneath your left foot.
links.link: p:(Action) investigate the strange texture beneath your left foot.

passages.name: p:(Action) Step inside the elevator cabin.

passages.text:
You look down and see an enormous dead rat underneath your foot.  Its mass is superior to any rodent you've encountered.

Jasper,surprised::The size of this specimen...Incredible...

[[C->investigate]]

links.name: C
links.link: investigate

passages.name: p:(Action) investigate the strange texture beneath your left foot.

passages.text:
Jasper,sad::Alright, fine, you don't have to pick it up.  But you should at least put your hand next to it so we can see how big it is.

[[p:(Action) Place your hand next to the enormous rodent.]]
[[p:I'd rather not.]]

links.name: p:(Action) Place your hand next to the enormous rodent.
links.link: p:(Action) Place your hand next to the enormous rodent.

links.name: p:I'd rather not.
links.link: p:I'd rather not.

passages.name: p:I don't want to pick it up, it's insides are putrified.

passages.text:
You place your tiny, pathetic hand next to the impressive carcass.  At once it's incredible girth becomes apparent.

Your tiny appendage cowers in its presence.

Jasper,thinking::Incredible.  It's easily over half a meter in length.  And it shows such obvious musculature on its back.

Jasper,head_tilted::I cannot imagine how it died.  Once you reach this size, you have no natural predators.

[[p:I wish that was me...]]
[[p:Such mass.  Such a sculpted, Vesuvian form.  What I would give to be that rat...->p:I wish that was me...]]

links.name: p:I wish that was me...
links.link: p:I wish that was me...

links.name: p:Such mass.  Such a sculpted, Vesuvian form.  What I would give to be that rat...
links.link: p:I wish that was me...

passages.name: p:(Action) Place your hand next to the enormous rodent.

passages.text:
Jasper,thinking::Alright, fine.  I guess we should get this drop underway.

[[C->ready to drop]]

links.name: C
links.link: ready to drop

passages.name: p:I'd rather not.

passages.text:
Jasper,sad::We all wish that were us.  We all wish we were such a dominant specimen.

Jasper,twisted::But we need to move on from this rat.  We can't let the siren call of impossible dreams stop us from getting what little we can out of life.

[[C->ready to drop]]

links.name: C
links.link: ready to drop

passages.name: p:I wish that was me...

passages.text:
Jasper::Alright.  Brace yourself.  And shove me extra deep in your pocket, if you don't mind.

[[(Action) Shove Jasper deeper into your pocket.]]
[[p:(Action) Smack the roof of the cabin.]]

links.name: (Action) Shove Jasper deeper into your pocket.
links.link: (Action) Shove Jasper deeper into your pocket.

links.name: p:(Action) Smack the roof of the cabin.
links.link: p:(Action) Smack the roof of the cabin.

passages.name: p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.
p:(Action) Smack the roof of the cabin.

passages.text:
You stand up with some difficulty and stumble towards the elevator cabin at the end of the hall.  It is nestled awkwardly into the end corner of the hallway, likely a later addition to the original construction.

The elevator is idled out of phase with respect to the floor, leaving a gap of several feet between the top of the cabin and the doorframe.

Jasper,thinking::Whew.  Ok.  We've just gotta step in and smack the roof, remember?  Nothing to it.

[[(Action) Look up the elevator shaft.]]
[[p:(Action) Step inside the elevator cabin.]]

links.name: (Action) Look up the elevator shaft.
links.link: (Action) Look up the elevator shaft.

links.name: p:(Action) Step inside the elevator cabin.
links.link: p:(Action) Step inside the elevator cabin.

passages.name: stand

passages.text:
You lean your head in above the cabin and look up the shaft.  You can see the artificial light from the rooftop machine room pouring in from above.

You can also see the faint outlines of the rigging equipment that once kept the cabin suspended.  Supposedly, only the magnetic backups remain functional.

[[C->stand]]

links.name: C
links.link: stand

passages.name: (Action) Look up the elevator shaft.

passages.text:
Jasper,twisted::Thanks.  Now that I'm deeper in here, I can provide padding for the heart and surrounding organs.  This is good for both of us.

[[C->p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.

passages.name: (Action) Shove Jasper deeper into your pocket.

passages.text:
Jasper,head_tilted::Do you think he heard us?

[[C->fall]]

links.name: C
links.link: fall

passages.name: p:......

passages.text: Jasper,surprised::Maybe w---....___
passages.name: fall

passages.text:
Jasper,thinking::I doubt he did.  The wind is pretty intense up there, and this building makes plenty of strange noises on its own.

Jasper,surprised::Julia might have heard it, though.  We should get moving.

[[C->practice fall]]

links.name: C
links.link: practice fall

passages.name: Did Wiggly not hear me crashing through the floor?

passages.text:
Jasper,sad::We've never had any chance to look up.  We've been too focused scrounging around dingy offices and squalid filing cabinets.

[[C->p:Where are we?]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:Where are we?

passages.name: I never noticed how nice this ceiling was.

passages.text:
Jasper,sad::Ugh.  What?  Where are we?  What just happened?

Jasper,thinking::I think we just fell through the roof?

[[p:I'm flat on my back, and my tailbone hurts, and I'm looking up at a hole in the ceiling.  So, I think that's a safe bet.]]
[[p:Let's not get ahead of ourselves.  There are other possibilities we need to rule out.]]

links.name: p:I'm flat on my back, and my tailbone hurts, and I'm looking up at a hole in the ceiling.  So, I think that's a safe bet.
links.link: p:I'm flat on my back, and my tailbone hurts, and I'm looking up at a hole in the ceiling.  So, I think that's a safe bet.

links.name: p:Let's not get ahead of ourselves.  There are other possibilities we need to rule out.
links.link: p:Let's not get ahead of ourselves.  There are other possibilities we need to rule out.

passages.name: Untitled Passage 2

passages.text:
Jasper,head_tilted::No need to get snarky with it.

[[C->practice fall]]

links.name: C
links.link: practice fall

passages.name: p:I'm flat on my back, and my tailbone hurts, and I'm looking up at a hole in the ceiling.  So, I think that's a safe bet.

passages.text:
Jasper,head_tilted::I think we're back near the stairwell we came up to the top floor on.

Jasper,twisted::We should be right next to the elevator cabin now, actually.  It should be over to the left.

Jasper,surprised::Can you move?

[[I never noticed how nice this ceiling was.]]
[[p:I'm good to crawl, at least.]]

links.name: I never noticed how nice this ceiling was.
links.link: I never noticed how nice this ceiling was.

links.name: p:I'm good to crawl, at least.
links.link: p:I'm good to crawl, at least.

passages.name: p:Where are we?

passages.text:
Jasper,twisted::Then let's slither into the cabin of the elevator so we can get down to the basement.

[[C->stand]]

links.name: C
links.link: stand

passages.name: p:I'm good to crawl, at least.

passages.text:
Jasper,thinking::Yes, you are right.  Maybe we were drugged again.  Maybe this is all just a bad nightmare and we're going through a series of false awakenings.

Jasper,surprised::Actually, no.  We definitely just fell through the floor.  I can remember the free-fall now.

[[C->practice fall]]

links.name: C
links.link: practice fall

passages.name: p:Let's not get ahead of ourselves.  There are other possibilities we need to rule out.

passages.text:
Jasper,head_tilted::I guess we can think of this as a practice fall.  We can handle a ten foot drop.  I think we're ready to take a thirty foot free-fall now.

[[Did Wiggly not hear me crashing through the floor?]]
[[p:Where are we?]]

links.name: Did Wiggly not hear me crashing through the floor?
links.link: Did Wiggly not hear me crashing through the floor?

links.name: p:Where are we?
links.link: p:Where are we?

passages.name: practice fall

passages.text:
Jasper,twisted::It's time to give Wiggly the signal to drop us.  Remember, we just need to slap the roof of the cabin, and he'll release the lever.

[[p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.]]
[[p:I'm excited for this, honestly.->p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.]]

links.name: p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.
links.link: p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.

links.name: p:I'm excited for this, honestly.
links.link: p:I'm ready for this.  I was born ready for this.

passages.name: ready to drop

passages.text:
Jasper,thinking::We have to investigate this.  Pick it up so we can weigh it, and document its size.

[[p:I don't want to pick it up, it's insides are putrified.]]
[[p:The giant rat is speaking to me; not with words, but more directly.  It's telling me not to pick it up.  "Not yet," it says.->p:I don't want to pick it up, it's insides are putrified.]]

links.name: p:I don't want to pick it up, it's insides are putrified.
links.link: p:I don't want to pick it up, it's insides are putrified.

links.name: p:The giant rat is speaking to me; not with words, but more directly.  It's telling me not to pick it up.  "Not yet," it says.
links.link: p:I don't want to pick it up, it's insides are putrified.

passages.name: investigate
